review:
The game is extremely buggy and some of the the puzzles and clues make no sense.  I have to press space or ESC multiple times to get the menus to appear, and sometimes the notes menu will be glitched with the items on the left side.   There is a texture glitch in the Workshop room that will put a player outside of the map with no way to return.  Had in instance where an item needed to complete a puzzle phase into a desk reducing time to complete the puzzle after spending multiple minutes retrieving it. The last puzzle room never worked for me. After following recommendations from others to let the tape play, the puzzle would still not activate.  

The art and story telling are nice, but I feel like there is still a lot of cleaning up that can be made to the before-mentioned items.

author: {'steamid': '76561198165980411', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 339, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 339, 'last_played': 1704099702}
review:
Fun idea but way too many bugs, especially in multiplayer.
 - got stuck in a wall/doorway in the workshop multiple times and had to quit to escape
 - the journal only works half the time and often doesn't respond to the key press in the first place
 - same with the ESC menu; takes multiple presses
 - couldn't finish the final level at all; the fuse boxes were glitched and the lights wouldn't turn on (either color)
In addition to the bugs, there's a few smaller things that would be great to have adjusted, such as multiple lanterns for multiplayer games or adding in the ability to save in multiplayer so that when a game-breaking bug inevitably happens, we don't lose everything...again.
The story is interesting and I love the atmosphere/art but unfortunately, I can't really recommend it until some of the bugs - at least the game-breaking ones - are fixed.

review:
The game could be brilliant. The puzzles are great, and I have enjoyed what's worked.

That's the problem, though. It's very buggy, and I'm forced to quit and start a new game due to various bugs. I'm not sure if I'm particularly unlucky, or if this is an issue for everyone. I happen to love escape room style games, and nothing has been overly-challenging or too simple.

I am confident that I did puzzles correctly, but they were broken. If I felt I solved it, but x component was faulty I verified it in the walk-through.

I experienced bugs specifically in the billiards room and the dark room. The dark room bug was not related to the lantern/light source. It was with only one photo appearing. I was able to process it correctly and have the image revealed, but I could not complete the second or third photos. It also kept referring to the photo with the image as a blank photo, even though you could clearly see an image. The billiards room bug was that I completed the puzzle, received the key, and then could not get the key to work on a single door on either floor.
I believe I encountered an error with the correct code not unlocking the door in the entrance hall once, but I can't verify. I may have simply not guessed the word properly, but I went through many times and ended up trying every possible word combination I could think of, even if it wasn't seemingly the answer to the riddle. I can't consider that one a glitch, but it felt broken.

I did report some bugs to the forum, but it doesn't seem as though they're still monitoring/fixing these issues.

I'll still play and enjoy it, but be wary! I haven't been able to play all the way through a single time yet. (I have only tried three times.)

author: {'steamid': '76561197996891752', 'num_games_owned': 679, 'num_reviews': 299, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1659465555}
review:
If you like escape room games, I guess this is not complete garbage. It has coop, but it is extremely buggy. The one unique thing about this game I have noticed so far is that each chapter consists of 5 randomly selected puzzles out of a larger pool, and it has a speedrun mechanic of sorts.

* In coop, the second player does not get a lantern item, so only 1 player can actually see what they are doing.
* The coop player model is just a silhouette of a man. It's extremely difficult to see search other.
* In coop, sometimes interactable doors are only interactable by one of the players.
* The note book feature and the pause menu opens like 40% of the time when pressing the keybind.
* The note book UI broke for us in one puzzle not allowing access to all found notes.
* Settings are very barebone
* Settings page has a keybind for "light" but it doesn't do anything.
* In some (most?) puzzles there are notes that are seemingly completely unnecessary to solve the puzzle.
* Visually the game as a lot to be desired, and I don't even mean graphics. Basic stuff like grandfather clocks that have no animation (???), level design holes in certain places, etc. It all feels quite low effort/quality.
* Piece of shit achievements that require 4 players
*  Sometimes entire chapters complete themselves in 0 seconds...

If you want another escape room game and are OK with aforementioned issues, I guess buy it on a sale.

review: Замечательный сборник интересных головоломок и загадок. К сожалению, не нашёл к игре русификатора, а играть без него крайне тяжело - многие загадки построены именно на знании английского языка, знании всех слов, умении менять местами буквы и собирать целые предложения из каши типа: "ererjmnmgfmhntyhmsdkvfsd". Необходимо обладать профессиональным знанием языка, как своего родного. Если же языковой барьер для вас не преграда - то это замечательный квест и пара - тройка приятных вечеров. Я, кстати говоря, не пробовал, но в игре есть кооператив и вы можете разгадывать головоломки вместе с друзьями. Ну и доставил также элемент Roguelike - на каждый этап (из 4) для прохождения необходимо разгадать 5 комнат, в пуле находится примерно 7-8 комнат-загадок, и они попадаются вам в случайном порядке. Да и сами по себе загадки не имеют всегда одного и того же решения - принцип отгадывания будет в одной и той же комнате в другом прохождении тем же, но ответ уже другой.

review:
I'm really enjoying this game!  I'm playing solo and it's a lot of fun!!  I see that folks have enjoyed the multiplayer option so I look forward to trying that, too.  The puzzles are good and challenging in just the right way (for me) - I have pay attention and search and think, but the clues aren't so esoteric that I can't possibly figure out the solution.  Puzzles are logical and solvable.  Some riddles are a little hard to figure, but there are only so many words possible with the letters to choose from, so if the answer isn't immediately apparent, a little trial and error didn't bother me.

My only quibble is that I had to complete the entire first episode before it would let me save my progress - maybe I blindly missed something and could have saved prior to that, but I couldn't find how.  So, several times, I had to replay the first few "acts", as I didn't have time to go all the way through the first episode in one go (though, even on casual, I finally did and found I made it with time to spare, had I played with a timer!  Woot!)  

I'll add that replaying wasn't really a bother, as the game is randomized and isn't identical each time you replay.  Each time, there were different puzzles though thematically, the room puzzles seemed consistent.  I really appreciate that!  

So, after several replays of the first acts, I've made it to the second episode and look forward to the rest of the game!  Maybe I'll play with the timer from now on, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080354065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 176, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1641730680}
review:
Nach 40 Minuten Spielzeit habe ich entnervt aufgehört.
Tastaturbelegung funktioniert nicht. Dark Mode funktioniert nicht (Lampe geht trotz aktiviertem Dark Mode immer wieder völlig wahllos aus und an - und das obwohl im Dark Mode eigentlich gar keine Lampe verfügbar ist). Wenn man den Dark Mode ausschaltet leuchtet die Lampe immer nur beim Drücken der Taste "1" obwohl "TAB" eingestellt war.
Am nervigsten ist aber die ständige Anzeige "Lantern" unten im Bild ohne jeden Grund. Dieser Text verdeckt leider die Statustexte von neuen Gegenständen oder gefundenen Objekten. Dies unterbricht den kompletten Spielfluss, da man dann häufig wichtige Objekte gar nicht als solche wahrnimmt.

Was soll das? Das ist bestenfalls Early Access Niveau. 

Man könnte argumentieren, dass das Spiel für Win 7 optimiert war, da es schon einige Jahre auf dem Buckel hat. Wenn ich mir die Rezensionen aber so ansehe, würde ich sagen, dass es auch damals schon diverse Probleme hatte. Liegt somit wohl eher nicht am Betriebssystem.
Aus unbekannten Gründen also von vorneherein nicht vernünftig zu Ende entwickelt. 

Eigentlich schade, denn Grafik und Atmosphäre machen einen super Eindruck.
Aber so macht es beim besten Willen keinen Spaß.

Ergänzung: Ach ja, speichern funktioniert auch nicht. Man muss also immer wieder von vorne anfangen.
Selbst wenn das Gameplay das beste der Welt wäre...in diesem Zustand gibts keine Empfehlung von mir.
No Way.

review:
You should absolutely be aware of the following issues before you buy this game:
- Some controls just don't work. Period. If you have a lantern in your inventory, you cannot turn it off, even though there's a keybind for it. Some puzzles require said controls to work in order to be solvable. Which makes the game unbeatable.
- The puzzles being procedurally generated can lead to situations where the game gives you a puzzle you cannot solve without guesswork. Minor spoilers for the format of a 1st episode puzzle: [spoiler]You have to arrange a variety of drinks and trinkets on a dining room table based on several logic puzzle-esque clues you find in the room (i.e. "the guest with the key sat next to the guest who brought Champagne"), but sometimes the game generates its clues in such a way that you have to guess for an item placement or two.[/spoiler] The game claims it's impossible to make a puzzle unsolvable through experimentation, so there's that at least, but this is very infuriating.
- The game is... only somewhat well-coded. There's a lot of cracks showing through the code, especially when it comes to menuing. I once accidentally deleted an object from the puzzle I was solving (thankfully not an essential piece of the puzzle) because I slotted a red lightbulb into a socket that already had another red lightbulb, causing the two to irreparably fuse.

review:
Great game, and it can be extremely challenging at times. You have to have an abstract way of thinking to be successful at these types of games. I did the entire playthrough with one other person, but I would imagine that singleplayer is just as fun. I only got stuck on one puzzle where after one hour of thought and no luck I had to google the solution (Which showed me that the game isn't random, more on that below), I never would have guessed the solution and failed to see the link between the puzzle and the solution, as did the other person I was playing with. 

While the game does describe itself as having randomly generated puzzles, this simply isn't correct. When I googled the before mentioned solution, I saw that the puzzle only had 4 words that could have been a solution. I quickly scrolled through the page and saw that all the other puzzles showed a similar thing. That means that all puzzles in the game have been pre-programmed, it's just that each time you play your puzzles are randomly selected from this already defined pool, so no, they are not randomly generated.

Despite this, I would still recommend it as it was a real fun game and I had a great time playing it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198447844453', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1023, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 447, 'last_played': 1631021681}
review:
Si, lo recomiendo!
Si te gustan los escape rooms, este juego puede gustarte y mucho. 
¿cómo no lo he descubierto antes? 
La longitud del juego es bastante buena, la facilidad de moverte por las distintas habitaciones y utilizar el inventario también, además de la música ambiental y el sonido.
Cada habitación te sumerge en puzzles que van desde descifrar códigos, claves, anagramas... descubrir secretos...y deambular libremente por cada rincón.
Es opcional utilizar una luz o linterna, algo que aconsejo y que puedes decidir desde las opciones de menú de configuración, además de encender y apagar luces, a veces forma parte de las claves, otras es sólo por añadir más iluminación a la sala.
Los puzzles son aleatorios, casi todos, de forma que al salvar el juego sólo podrás guardar el nivel en el que estás en la mayoría de los casos, por lo que al cargar la habitación seguramente tendrás que comenzar el juego, es una cuestión de rejugabilidad.
El lenguaje es una barrera? 
Sí y no. 
 Con un traductor será suficiente, tampoco hay que leer tanto, pero es cierto que hay algún que otro puzzle en el que si no dominas el inglés puede costarte algo, pero como dije antes no hay problema con las herramientas que puedes encontrar como traductores y otras, 
Otra opción que me ha gustado mucho es el poder jugar sin un tiempo límite. Los juegos con un tiempo para poder resolver me estresan y al final creo que se acaba acudiendo a las pistas que tiene el juego (tres por cada sala) o a buscarlo por otro lado. Y esa opción es para mí la mejor, disfrutar el juego sin que el tic tac del reloj te ponga límite.Si eliges esta última opción verás que en cada habitación siempre hay un reloj, con o sin minutero según lo que elijas.
Dificultad: hay de todo, pero nada que no se pueda sacar dándote tu tiempo. Hasta ahora creo que el juego dispone de 15 habitaciones, y digo creo porque aún lo he terminado. Y por mucha prisa que tengas en acabarlo, mi consejo es que te des tu tiempo y lo disfrutes antes de resolverlo con ayuda.
Hay un par de guías que son muy buenas y te sacarán de la habitación si te ves atorado. Hasta ahora he encontrado dos habitaciones con puzzles tipo "prueba y error", pero el resto tiene su lógica, es sólo cuestión de encontrarla.
Y además tiene la opción de jugarlo a solas o en coop. 
Le doy un 9/10 hasta que se traduzca al español :)

Estoy un poco conflictuado con este juego, ya que si bien el diseño de los puzzles es genial y te hacen pensar bastante tiempo, el juego en el estado actual es muy dificil de jugar. Está plagado de bugs, y está bastante roto en ese sentido. En algunos momentos no sabes si no estás entendiendo el puzzle o algo se rompió y no apareció una pista o algo así. 

La camara se mueve sola, se inclina despacio hacia la derecha y hacia abajo, así que a veces es muy difícil ver alguna pista que tenes que prestar atención, o tenes que anotar y necesitas mantenerla en pantalla por unos segundos. Por ejemplo, en un puzzle necesitaba ver una luz para sacar un codigo morse (Que por algún motivo no tenia sonido, y todavía no sé si es a propósito, o si es un bug), y es casi imposible anotar el código con la cámara moviéndose por sí sola. Ni hablar de ingresar un código en una caja fuerte o algo así, ya que hay que hacerlo en un punto interactivo bastante pequeño y con la cámara moviéndose cuesta el doble. 

Guardar la partida tambien es una cuestión de suerte, ya que a veces el botón no responde, no aparece la opción de guardar, despues aparece, es azar puro. Sumándole a eso que el botón de escape a veces no anda y hay que ametrallarlo a lo loco (Quiero creer que no es mi teclado, no tengo ese problema en otros juegos, y encima el teclado es nuevo, tendré yo tanta mala suerte?) 

En fin, el juego es bueno, y todavía voy a seguir jugándolo porque sé que es bastante rejugable, y nisiquiera terminé mi primera partida. Es un juego relativamente barato, tiene multiplayer (aunque todavía no lo probé), y el diseño de los escenarios, puzzles, textos, música, ambiente, son todos buenos... pero los bugs son preocupantes, y juego con el riesgo de que un día directamente no va a cargarme la partida. Yo diría de esperar un tiempo (no sé si todavía recibe actualizaciones, si ya está abandonado entonces mala leche), pero tampoco siento que haya sido un desperdicio.

review:
Great game, I've replayed all of the chapters several times now to catch everything (I think) 

Almost all of these puzzles are unique and challenging. Some of course are easier than others, and some will keep you stumped for a bit. 
Note here for other players : This game does have several math puzzles (most of them simple) but if you don't care for math puzzles, I would not play this game.
  All good things aside, the end game experience is not good.  You spend 4+ hours getting through all of the chapters to ultimately end up with a complicated Algebra question that doesn't make sense even with the walk-through. 
I know y'all wanted the last puzzle to be hard, but please, for the love of everything that is this brilliant game - do.something. else. You will drive people away if you hook them for 4 hours of play and strip them of a satisfying ending. I hate that I had to look at a walk-through to finish something I was invested in. And even then, it feels rushed and underwhelming. 

End note, if you want to play this as a brain teaser game then i'd recommend it. But until the ending has been reworked, I would not recommend this, as it ruins the overall feeling of accomplishment. Great game to keep your eye on in the future though if you like escape rooms.

review:
Overall, it's a fun escape room type game to play with friends. There are light horror aspects to it, which make the settings interesting. The puzzles need more depth to them with a more direct tie in to the story. This is easily the biggest complaint of the game and more than likely where most of the negative reviews are coming from. While the set pieces are interesting, a large handful of these rooms are usually just riddles or place X amount of items in a certain order. This makes reruns of the game a breeze, despite there being some soft elements of randomness added per each run (Only certain rooms are available per each act, unless you're doing a chaos gauntlet run). I personally didn't mind how cryptic some of these rooms were, but I definitely found myself asking aloud how I (we) were supposed to know that (after some 30 minutes of looking around). The game has some soft rogue like elements, so you can go back and play the Acts with different outcomes. 

[i] If a Dev sees this and is planning on making a sequel or update: [/i]
[spoiler] 
Rooms like the Chess Room and the Astronomy Room were the most memorable. That's because they broke the normal mold of each puzzle room and required alternative ways for solving (albeit with little explanation). There were cool set ups of puzzles in the Green Room and the Transfer Room, but the room themes weren't built around in unique manners. Again they were just spell a word, solve a riddle, look for numbers and patterns, rinse repeat. This is totally fine for some filler rooms. However, It would have been much more memorable if each of these things tied in directly to the story. I.E. the riddles were riddles directly related to a character in the story.  Once you know that about a character, you have to use it to solve a room (this was lightly done with the true/false candle room). Again, some of the riddles and poems more directly tie into the general story and ambience. It's just not enough to make the story shine. The rogue like elements were perfect and caught me off guard. I would love to see even more variation in a future product. Finally, more direct horror elements would make this game even more enjoyable with friends. Not jump scares per se, although it could be interesting with a live monster AI looming about. Even having the clock play into the puzzle solving would be fun. The game had some glitches we ran into, particularly the duping of items. We also fell through the map into another room once, but this was rare. 

I was hoping that there was a secret ending only revealed if you solved all the puzzles in a certain way from Act 1 through Act 4. There were some hints that suggested one.
[/spoiler]

Worth playing with some friends when on sale. Has a ton of room for growth as the basic idea is great for people that love puzzle solving. Some puzzles are just down right unfun and more tedious than anything (8 Letter arrangement puzzle). However, a large amount of the rooms are fun if you're somewhat experienced with these types of puzzles. Is the love child of We Were Here and Amnesia/Penumbra (minus the extreme horror).

review:
The game is difficult but entertaining, definitely an experience to be shared with friends (If only for the added brain power). The puzzles range from intuitive, to almost indiscernable, and it will sometimes take a fair bit of trial and error or flat out guess work to figure out pieces to the problem at hand. Most of the challenge is figuring out the puzzle and THEN solving the puzzle.

Often the puzzles can be solved by figuring out the meaning of hints left throughout the room, though they are often hidden behind wordplay and difficult to understand. The game uses several categories of puzzle to entrap players, so a group should have members who are good with language, mathematics, and visual clues in order to progress without running out of time.

In terms of replayability, the game does randomize rooms and room orders, but the puzzles remain the same. Though component parts are changed, the framework is constant, so the rooms become very easy to beat on another play because the puzzle is already known.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998568769', 'num_games_owned': 671, 'num_reviews': 828, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1545575854}
review:
6.5/10

I can recommend Last Will, although there are certainly some annoyances that I had with it. I really enjoy playing co-op escape rooms with a friend of mine, and Last Will represents our latest foray into the genre. The length of the game was satisfactory, consisting of four "episodes" each containing five rooms. Therefore, a single playthrough will involve solving 20 rooms with varying types of puzzles.

One of the strongest aspects of the game was actually the framework. The game provides a compelling motivation for you to be at your Grandfather's mansion, and your Grandfather certainly seems like the type of person who would put together a puzzle gauntlet like the one you experience in-game. I won't reveal any more here, but I don't think you'll be disappointed upon reaching the end.

My first issue with the game was with how intuitive some of the puzzles were. We consulted a walkthrough to aid us in solving "The Workshop," "The Isolated Study," and "The Observatory." With respect to The Workshop, we had extreme difficulty locating a gear that is hidden in the bottom drawer of a cash register. We wandered around the adjoining rooms for what seemed like forever, oblivious to the fact that this bottom drawer even existed. At the same time, I was dissuaded from looking too closely, as I had gotten trapped behind a radio in one of the rooms we played prior and then had to restart the episode. I wasn't a fan of the puzzles that were more riddle-like in nature, but preferred the puzzles that relied more on careful environmental observation.

My second issue was with how five rooms in each episode are randomly pulled from a larger bank. Therefore, to experience all of the puzzles that the developer put into the game, you'll need to replay each episode. It's possible that you still won't see any new rooms, and so you may have to replay again and again to see everything. Perhaps the developer thought that players would want to replay the episodes over and over to shoot for better times, but my co-op partner and I had no interest in this. We would much rather be able to choose in some way the rooms that we hadn't played yet, just to see everything the title had to offer.

Although Last Will had its share of irritations, if you have a friend who likes playing through these digital escape rooms (like I do), there is plenty to like here. We only found 3 of the 20 puzzles we experienced to be poorly-designed, so there were plenty that we found clever and intriguing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147828630', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1518883304}
review:
First saw the NLSS crew play the game, bought the game on a sale, and played along with 3 other friends over discord. The overall feel of the game is quite similar to generic 'escape the room' puzzles, with a lot of focus towards sitting down and figuring out the answers to riddles, puzzles, etc.

I've previously played a couple games in a similar genre; notably 'We Were Here' and 'Portal 2'. Last will provided quite a different experience from these two titles. The game felt traditional. It reminded me of the room escape flash games I've played back in the day, and it didn't try for much gimmicks. Instead, what it had was a solid selection of puzzles (although some have minor issues) for players to tackle through either solo, or co-op.

Admittedly, I don't care much about the story of these games, but most of the time me and my friends were quite focused on solving the puzzles that we didn't quite feel like the game needed more story. If you're planning to buy this game, keep in mind that most of the game is focused towards finding clues and figuring out puzzles/riddles.

When we played (Silent Night update) we encountered some glitches, but none of them were game-breaking for us. The only inconvinience we really had was when the player holding the light source would disconnect. The game became very difficult without enough light, and this disconnecting and reconnecting felt a little janky.

In terms of price, I'd say it's a reasonable price for people willing to spend hours solving puzzles. If you like solving traditional riddles and escape room puzzles, you'll like this game. If you're here for something like 'We Were Here', the game's not too far off, but it would depend on what you're looking for.

In conclusion: it's a solid game to play solo or with friends, however there are slight issues that may interfere with your experience. Personally liked how traditional the approach was. 7/10

review:
Great game to play with some friends. We played it as a group of 4 and we finished it in just below 5 hours in one playthrough. If you decide to "replay" another episode, the puzzles will be mixed up and you would also encounter new puzzles. I personally did not encounter any bugs on my side, though two of my other friends did. They either were stuck on a loading loop or froze when entering a door. They just restarted and re-joined the room and never had the problem come up again.

My only gripe about the game is the difficulty of the rooms. At least for me, there was never really a "medium" difficulty puzzle. It was either pretty simple and "easy" (finished in under 5 minutes) or something that was "hard" (finished in 15-20 minutes). I would recommend setting the episode timers on (I believe there's an only option for 60 minutes), instead of having an unlimited time to finish the episodes. It definately makes situations a little more tense and stressful at times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006061535', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 628, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1507241530}
review:
Wer kennt es nicht? Da erfährt man vom Tod seines Großvaters und bekommt anstatt einer Trauerzeit eine Einladung zu einer speziellen Erbvergabe im alten Herrenhaus. Denn nur ein schlauer Erbjunge darf alles behalten, wobei dieser unter Zeitdruck Rätsel lösen muss. Sollte dies nicht gelingen, so würde das alte Anwesen in sich selbst zusammenfallen ... samt Erbling. Also entwickeln sich über die Zeit neben extrinsischen auch intrinsische Motivationen um diesem Spuk wieder zu entkommen.

Dabei sind die Rätsel nicht linear angeordnet sondern zufällig verteilt. Man startet zwar in der Eingangshalle, aber die sich öffnende Tür, wie auch der nächste Raum sind zufällig. Es gibt einzig eine Untergliederung in einzelne Kapitel, welche jeweils einen Pool an Räumen besitzen. 

Die Schwierigkeit steigt dabei auch nicht monoton an, sondern wechselt sich stets zwischen sehr einfach und einfach aufwendig ab. Die Zufälligkeit wird dabei teilweise auch innerhalb der Rätselräume (andere Schlüsselworte, Gegenstände stehen anders etc...)  verwendet, sodass auch hier kein stures Muster genutzt werden kann. Dies ist eine erfrischende Auflockerung des typischen Room by Room- Prinzips, kann jedoch nicht immer überzeugen. Es kann dabei leider zu komischen Konstellationen kommen, welche sogar erstaunlicherweise nicht mehr eindeutig in der Lösung oder einfach fehlerbehaftet sind [spoiler] (In der Eingangshalle müssen drei Worte gefunden und in den passenden Orten an den Buchstabenscheiben eingestellt werden. Ist nun das gesuchte Wort durch Zufall die Initialkombination der Scheiben, so zählt dies nicht als Lösung, sondern man muss erst alle Scheiben mindest um eine Position verschieben).[/spoiler].  
Trotz allem gibt es auch wirklich interessante Rätsel, welche ein Aha-Erlebnis zulassen. Es werden übrigens auch nie alle Poolräume genutzt sondern nur eine gewisse Auswahl, was die Wiederspielbarkeit (neben der Zufälligkeit der Rätselräume an sich) deutlich erhöht. 

Trotzdem muss ich zugeben, dass ich nicht unbedingt dieses Erbe bzw. auch dieses Anwesen besitzen wöllte. Da die Räume zufällig sind, sind die Zwischengänge auch relativ interessant verteilt. Eine Zeichnung des gesammten so abgelaufenen Komplexes sollte einem Architekten schon die Schweißperlen auf die Stirn treiben.

Wirklich interessant ist auch der Fakt, dass die einen verfolgende Uhrzeit ausgestellt werden kann bzw. man dieses Abenteuer auch als Gruppe angehen kann (Erbteilung?).

Fazit: Sehr unterhaltsames, wie auch motivierendes Rätselspiel mit leicht vorhersehbarem Ende.

Schwierigkeit: 4/10
Erfolge: 48 (Innerhalb der Zeit alles schaffen, jeden Raum schaffen etc.: Es sind mehrere Spieldurchläufe notwendig )
Spielzeit: 2-3h pro Runde

review:
I do so totally recomend this game. 
Although, keep in mind that this game is focused on a specific kind of player. If you like puzzle games, if you like thinking and figuring out how to solve enigmas, then you will love the game. If you expect an easy path through a story telling experience like The Stanley parable, or if you do expect it to be some kind of immersive horror game with some puzzles like Amnesia, then do not try it, because you may be dissapointed.
The very best with the game is the amount of different puzzles and riddles, as for now (7 played hours, I know it is little, but the game is not that long either), I have not experienced all of them, and the developers are still producing more complex rooms.
The bad side is the polishing. The rooms sometimes look weird builded by the randomizing motor, some textures do not fit exactly with each other, there are some light bugs, etc., and all this can affect the immersive experience. I guess the developers are more experienced with puzzles and motors than with user experience. The ambientance is ok, not that much impressive, but considering how the game is being carried, I can not expect other than improvement in that matter.
In few words, consider it a puzzle game and you will enjoy it at maximum. Also, think that the developers are investing a lot of time on it, updating and expanding the game, making it playable, replayable and enjoyable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018506339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 802, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1489842490}
review:
Auch wenn ich zugeben muss, dass es den Anschein erweckt, dass die Entwickler in letzter Zeit etwas langsam arbeiten (der letzte Patch ist schon über einen Monat her), würde ich jedem Rätsel-Fan dieses Spiel nur empfehlen. 

Ja, es hängt gerade an der letzten Episode und ich will auch nicht sagen, dass in den erste dreien keine das Spiel stark beeinflussenden Bugs gab, aber dennoch habe ich persönlich das Gefühl, dass sich das Team hinter "Last Will" sehr darum bemüht uns Spielern ein tolles Erlebnis zu bieten. Wenn ich Fragen bzw. Bug-Reports abgeschickt hatte, gab es in aller Regel schnell eine Antwort, wenn nicht sogar zeitnah einen Hot-Fix für das Problem. In dem Sinne kann man sich echt nciht beschweren.

Zum Spiel an sich muss ich sagen, gefällt es mir von der Art und vor Allem der Atmosphäre sehr. Die Rätsel sind zum Teil sehr leicht, zum Teil aber auch sehr schwer, sodass man weder das Gefühl der Unter-, noch der Überforderung hat. Einzig die Aussage, dass es oft mehr als einen Lösungsweg in einem Raum gibt, finde ich irreführend. Es mag für dne ersten Raum zutreffen, aber bei vielen der folgenden Räumen sehe ich immer nur genau eine Art das Rätsel zu knacken. Etwas schade.

Alles in Allem gebe ich dem Spiel aber 8/10 Punkten.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998451693', 'num_games_owned': 697, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 118, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1476955331}
review:
The issue is that the puzzles are poorly written.

Look, I enjoy difficult puzzles, I enjoy brain teasers and struggling to come up with answers. There is, however, a difference between that and puzzles that explain themselves so poorly that either you immediately get them because they're obvious or can't get them at all because they make no sense. One run (on episode 1) I blasted through the whole thing with no problem. Another run I couldn't get past the first room because the riddles were horribly constructed.

The issue with puzzle games is they're held hostage to the logic of the people who write the riddles, and the devs here, although having good ambition, are simply not good at making riddles. In the first room there are a dozen or so 4-letter puzzles that are randomly selected. Some are very easy, some make no sense at all. If you get the simple ones, you'll feel clever and think this game is great. If you get the bad ones, you'll be stuck forever and not progress.

I like spooky games with more than just key hunting and jump scares. What the devs here need to understand is just because they spent every day for months looking at these puzzles doesn't mean they'll make even the faintest of sense to someone coming in new. Cannot recommend. Far too headache inducing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056091143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 724, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1594495326}
review:
BEFORE READING - - - 
I HAVE completed all rooms available at the current time, so if this is read after the 30th, some things I say here may not be true or may not apply.
- - - 

This is a very well put together game, the story is intriguing, the graphics are beautiful, and there are very few glitches and bugs that I have run into so far.

First up, the puzzles. The puzzles in this game are very challenging, and are well put together, some of them, however, admittedly do need some work. *cough * the bunker *cough * They are not too easy to figure out, and not too challenging that they are unsolvable within the time frame. One thing I would say is a complaint of mine are the ranges of difficulties in the puzzles, as in, one room you enter may have a super difficult puzzle, while the next one is a breeze, so I would suggest somehow structuring them from easies to hardest when running through.

Next, the story. The story of this game can be put together through notes that your grandfather leaves you, and in one case, a tape recording, but it does require some reading, so be prepared for that rather than cut scenes or other methods of delivery. The story itself is interesting, but not too complicated, and not too bland.

Next up, the Music. There is not much to say about the music in this game, the music they use fits the game very well, but I wouldn't call it anything special. (sorry)

And Finally, the bugs/glitches. As I said earlier, I have been playing this game with my buddy, and we have come across a few bugs in this mode. The ones we did come across were not game breaking, however. I wouldn't exactly call this one a bug, but more of an unintended feature, we found that you can prop surf if you can find the right props, like the chairs in the main entryway of the mansion.  A REAL bug we found is that you can duplicate items by picking them up simultaneously, not game breaking, but annoying when you accidentally click an item at the same time and then have to carry it around for the rest of your play through. There was also an instance (I'm not sure how this happened) where we were able to open a door that lad locked behind us, and when we walked through it, we fell out of the map, but it does teleport you back into the Map once you fall far enough, so good on the devs, I guess.

Overall this is a very fun game, it is well put together, and though it does have some bugs, I very much look forward to playing the next two acts. Thanks for reading :).

review:
There are a lot of bugs currently, two specifically has to deal with losing save files and not being able to connect to your friend' games for multiplayer. This defintiely needs to be addressed soon.

The game also is hindered by some delays (room 3 should've been out 23rd of Sept. 2016, the developer mentioned it being delayed until the 25th and it's now the 26th with no updates) and really easy puzzles. The game also makes an effort to randomize rooms for replayability but imho there isn't enough rooms currently to warrant the effectiveness of this. I find myself playing the same old puzzles and using the same strategies to solve the rooms -- it's somewhat monotone in nature.

Ultimately, I do love the concept and the multiplayer aspect this game has to offer but at this stage I would stay away, maybe if the game was 5 USD I would recommend at its current timeline.

I love puzzle games, especially escape the room types. I love creepy atmospheres and good soundtracks, and this game has all of it. The puzzles are challenging (episodes 1 & 2 are out right now, waiting to dive into episode 3!), but not too much so. 

As is common with puzzle games, once you solve a room, you will know how it's done, so next time around you will be able to solve these rooms in a matter of minutes. I appreciate the variety the rooms offer and I think the puzzles are pretty inventive. There's a nice mix of traditional puzzles with new and fancy ones.

What I enjoy more than anything about this game, is the multiplayer! Even puzzles you've solved a thousand times get a new life when you're watching a friend solve these puzzles all over again. :D Play it with friends!

I love the active updating as well! Good job, people!

review:
So.. Normally I dont really play puzzle-games, but a friend of mine encouraged me to get this so I did.
At first I was a bit bewildered. "Now what?" but as I walked around the 1st room it slowly started to come together. The dark and oppressive atmosphere really highlights the mood of the game. I was pleasantly surprised by several details in the game such as opening/closing cabinets, where you have to guide it open with the mouse. A feature I could imagine working really great with VR goggles and controllers.
The Graphics pretty good. It's obvious that it's a small developer and therefore has its limits but visually it's quite beautiful. Especially the paintings that are scattered everywhere are a really nice touch.
The puzzles I encountered were varying in difficulty.. I found the 3rd one the hardest and the 2nd the easiest. The fact that they are mixed around and randomised gives the game quite a bit of replay value. Ofcourse the principles remain similar but it's quite well thought out.
I would definitly recommend getting this little gem.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046294402', 'num_games_owned': 1034, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 276, 'last_played': 1510892002}
review:
"Last Will" ist ein firstperson Escape-Room-Spiel in einem schicken Setting und mit guten Spielmodi: Entweder rätselt man sich gemütlich, unter Zeitdruck oder im online-Multiplayer Modus durch die Räumlichkeiten eines alten Anwesens. Letztgenannter Spielmodus ist auch zagfhaften Neueinsteigern zu empfehlen (siehe nächster Absatz).

Spürnasen, die mit "The Room" oder "The Room 2" ihren Spaß hatten, dürften sich leicht in "Last Will" einfinden, obgleich dieser Titel nicht komplett artverwand ist. Die eigentlichen Rätsel sind in der ersten Episode in Anzahl überschaubar und grundsätzlich recht flott machbar, sofern man die Hinweise verstanden hat. Das Dechiffrieren der Hinweise ist der eigentliche Spaß und dieser wird durch den Mehrspieler-Modus deutlich aufgewertet. Dann gilt es, richtig miteinander zu kommunizieren, um zur Lösung zu gelangen.

Aber auch im Singleplayer-Modus, beispielsweise mit Stift und Zettel ausgestattet, macht "Last Will" Spaß. Bis ich im Alleingang die Spielmechaniken verinnerlicht und die Hälfte der Rätsel gelöst hatte, vergingen 4 Stunden. Zwo Räume / Türen gilt es für mich noch zu erkunden. Schlauere Nüsschen werden die Aufgaben vermutlich deutlich zügiger gelöst bekommen. Vor allem in der Gruppe sollte weniger Rätselfrust oder Längen auftreten.

Da ein Neustart eines jeweiligen Raumes die Hinweise und Interaktionsobjekte teilweise mit anderen austauscht, wird "Last Will" so schnell nicht langweilig.

Mir gefällt die atmosphärisch-gruselige Soundkulisse, die Steuerung, das Teamplay und das Hilfesystem. Rätselprofis dürften manche Aufgabe bereits kennen und mit der ersten Episode unterfordert sein. Auch kann man über die Zugänglichkeit des Schmetterling-Rätsels geteilter Meinung sein.

Ob sich der Preis für alle Episoden rechtfertigt, muss die Zeit zeigen. Ich freue mich jedenfalls auf die noch folgenden Herausforderungen.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995194702', 'num_games_owned': 1227, 'num_reviews': 714, 'playtime_forever': 142, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1473101403}
review:
Je tu další zajímavý pokus o inovaci v žánru escape room her. Zapíše se ale do historie nebo naopak upadne do zapomnění?

[h1]Tak trochu adventura, tak trochu escape room[/h1]
Je to zhruba čtyři měsíce, co jsem recenzoval hru Mysterious Castle. Ta byla také ze stejného žánru a také byla ve 3D. Narozdíl od ní se zde ale můžete volně procházet. Ona celkově tahle hra působí spíše jako adventura v trojrozměrném prostředí, než klasická escape room hra.

Je to dáno především tím, že tu máte místnosti, kdy v každé je pouze jeden jediný druh hádanky, po jejímž správném vyřešení se vám otevřou dveře do další. Kromě hádanek tu máte ale i hromadu zbytečných prázdných šuplíků, různých věcí, které vám k ničemu nebudou a pak také občas nápovědy k danému úkolu.

A i když někteří můžou vyzdvihovat právě to, že tu drtivou většinu času tápete a hledáte různé věci, tak mě osobně se to moc nelíbilo. Otevírat každičký šuplík a doufat, že tam naleznete kýžený předmět je po čase otrava.

[h1]50 odstínů hádanek[/h1]
Bohužel lépe na tom nejsou ani ony hádanky, které možná zprvu působí složitě a geniálně, ve skutečnosti jsou ale vcelku obyčejné a již stokrát viděné. Hned první místnost obsahuje tři slovní hříčky, kdy musíte uhodnout slovo, které onen text vystihuje a poté jej zadat na panelu na stěnách. A jelikož je hra pouze v angličtině, je jasné, že neangličtináři tu nemají co dělat.

Tyhle hádanky se generují náhodně, tudíž jich tu je vícero a já sám narazil minimálně na tři různé sady. No a poté přijdou další místnosti, které ale obsahují mnohdy podprůměrné hříčky, kdy slovo "hříčky" je zcela na místě. Nevím, koho by mohla bavit minihra s motýly, kdy musíte neustále jak blbeček pobíhat tam a zase zpátky a mačkat spínače a doufat, že všechen okřídlený hmyz bude ve správné poloze.

Ale abych jen nehanil, tak tu byla  jedna hádanka, která hru celkem vyzdvihla. Místnost s řešením toho, kde seděl jaký host a co zrovna měl u sebe byla parádní a být taková celá hra, hodnocení hned vypadá zcela jinak.

[h1]Více lidí, větší zábava[/h1]
Ještě jsem nenapsal nic o příběhu, ten tu ale není. Respektive tu jsou střípky toho, co a proč se děje, ale pochybuji, že by to někoho skutečně zajímalo. Na druhou stranu tu je něco, co by mohlo zachránit hratelnost a potažmo i celou tuhle hru...

Ano, řeč je o tolik proklamovaném coop multiplayeru, kdy v až čtyřech lidech můžete řešit hádanky a postupovat dál opuštěným sídlem. Uznávám, že se to může zdát být zábavné, jenže je nutné si uvědomit, že samotný základ hry je hodně špatný a tudíž ani tenhle aspekt, byť zajímavý, vás nevytrhne. Navíc si nemyslím, že by to byla funkce, kterou využije většina nakupujících. Zkrátka a dobře - coop je tu vítaným zpestřením, ale když je hra špatná, ani tato funkce ji nezachrání.

[h1]Poslední vůle[/h1]
No a v neposlední řadě tu je audiovizuální zpracování, které je stěží průměrné. Nejsem žádný grafický maniak, ale občas mi připadalo, že se kvalita vizuálu zasekla v roce 2005. Hudba je tu pak celkem podprůměrná a brzy po dohrání i zapomenete, že tu nějaká vůbec byla.

Na konec se sluší i poznamenat, že hra Last Will je rozdělena na epizody. Máte o tom varování i na stránce v obchodu na Steamu a hlavně díky tomu je nutné brát tuhle recenzi s rezervou. Měl jsem tu čest pouze s první epizodou, takže je dost možné, že si tvůrci dají záležet a kvalita půjde strmě nahoru nebo naopak zůstane vše při starém.

[h1]Plusy[/h1]
+ atmosféra
+ různé hádanky
+ hra je chvílemi hodně zábavná
+ multiplayer

[h1]Mínusy[/h1]
- hra měla větší potenciál (může se ještě změnit)
- většina hádanek je nudných a některé se stěží dají nazvat hádankami
- špatné audiovizuální zpracování
- první epizoda je krátká (jde dohrát i za hodinu)
- občas skřípe ovládání pohybu
- zatím cena (13 euro za 1 hodinu)

[h1]Konečný verdikt[/h1]
[b]Mé hodnocení: 4/10[/b]

Kdo ví, možná jsem od téhle hry čekal víc. Stále jsem totiž nadšený z úžasné série The Room, což je stejný žánr, akorát je kvalitou zcela někde jinde. Bude určitě zajímavé sledovat, jak se tvůrci hry popasují s kvalitou svého díla a zda jej přivedou do zdárného konce.

Absolutely loving this concept, and I'm dying for more rooms and puzzles to be released in the coming weeks!!

Seriously, it's wonderful to have a game of puzzles that actually requires more thinking out the answers than just searching for the right item to unlock another item that unlocks something else, etc... any puzzle game that makes me want to jot notes out on paper and pace a little bit in my room as I work out the answer is a welcome sight!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049051420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1472915913}
review:
主に文書を読んで謎を解くタイプの脱出？ゲームです。
言語不要の直感的なギミックはあまりない感じ。

この手のゲームでCo-op可能というのに惹かれて購入。
4人でプレイしましたが、3部屋目の謎解きにて
"文書から推理して各種アイテムを特定の位置に置く"という謎解きがあるのですが
アイテムが各プレイヤーで同期されていないのか、Aが水を置く→他の3人にはコンパスが表示される
そして3人の誰かがその置かれたコンパスを再取得すると、水が消滅してコンパスになってしまう・・・
という致命的なバグが起こります。
あと正解の場所に置かないと、他の3人には表示自体がされない模様？

それで4人が各々、ああじゃないこうじゃないと取ったり置いたりしていると
最終的に水0個のコンパス4個、とかいう状況になり詰みます。
そしてやり直そうとすると1部屋目からです。

あとは開かないはずの部屋のドアが開いたりと、
マルチしかプレイしていませんが、ちょっとバグが多い感じです。

バグがなければ、Co-opでワイワイやるのは楽しそうです。
綺麗で雰囲気が良いだけに残念。修正を待ちます。

あと最初の部屋でランタンが拾えますが、1つしかない（一人しか持てない）のが辛い。
部屋の各所に点灯可能なランプはありますが、全体的に部屋が暗いので・・・

review:
4人でコープをしましたが、３部屋目で素敵な現象が起こり断念しました。

※例（多少のネタバレ要素がありますが、ご了承ください）

プレイヤーをAさん、Bさん、Cさん、Dさんとします。

１）Aさんが、水を置く→B/C/Dの画面上はウィスキーが表示される。
２）Aさんが石を置き、鳥籠を置く→B/C/Dティーポットが２つ表示される。
３）Aさんが置いた物（石）をBさんが拾う（ティーポット）→Bさんのインベントリではティーポットが表示される。
４）Bさんが拾ったティーポットを置く→Aさんの画面では表示されない。

上記のようなバグ？をふまえて、Aさんがすべてのアイテムを設置
→Bさんがすべて回収する
→Bさんのインベントリ（ナイフx3、水x2、ティーポットx4...etc）

といったように、ワケワカメになってしまったのでゲームを断念しました。

review:
[h1] Хочешь денег? Отгадай загадку [/h1]

Ходили в квест-комнаты в своём городе? Теперь можете ходить не выходя из дома.
По сюжету игры мы попадаем в особняк своего деда, который недавно скопытился, в надежде урвать кусок его состояния. Но деда был знатным Скруджем Макдаком и делится с тупой роднёй не хотел. Вот и придумал забаву, благодаря которой отпрыски смогут унести с собой немного монет.
Нужно ни много ни мало - ̶п̶о̶к̶р̶у̶т̶и̶т̶ь̶ ̶б̶а̶р̶а̶б̶а̶н̶ ̶и̶ ̶п̶е̶р̶е̶д̶а̶т̶ь̶ ̶п̶р̶и̶в̶е̶т̶  решить все дедовские загадки.

+ рандомно генерируемые загадки. Уровень всё тот же, но расположение подсказок и сами загадки генерируются каждый раз заново
+ наличие подсказок на уровне, без которых было бы совсем тяжко
+ кооператив
+ нетребовательность к железу. Я спокойно играл без видяхи просто на проце i7 с его встроенным ядром и чувствовал себя нормально
+ постепенное добавление новых эпизодов

Главный минус для православного игрока - отсутствие локализации. Все загадки на английском, все все подсказки и записки тоже. Будьте готовы.
На выходе имеет добротно сделанный квест, над которым действительно придётся попотеть. Разнообразные загадки, интерактивное окружение, возможность кооперативного прохождение практически на любом железе ждут вас здесь.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312265861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 350, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1473651750}
review:
REVISED 9/11/16: This game is really frustrating. It should have stayed in Beta / Greenlight another 6 months. Was excited for the next set of rooms (episode 2). Started playing it and realized the 2nd episode was even more unfinished than the 1st. Bugs and broken features.

Not fun anymore. Maybe we'll check in on it again....
----------------------------------------------
My boyfriend and I were anxiously waiting for this game to come out, and are very happy that it has, finally! The game has really good puzzles and the randomizer makes for really fun replay value. It was like Myst meets escape room. Curious to see what online co-op is like. That being said...
The game needs some work still. Devs, listen up.

Please be aware this game is NOT GAMEPAD SUPPORTED. And does not save key configs.

Our save game sort of saved. It brought us back to the same room, but the puzzle was different, so all our notes from the night before, useless. The "Red Trailed" room puzzle seems broken. 
Jerky motion when looking around, especially around clickables. 
Clicking on objects/multiple objects when not even facing them (scaring the crap out of us when the record player would start playing, omg, and chess pieces being Poltergeist-ed at us AHH!!)

Other things like (un)intentional spelling errors in clues, gfx artifacts, etc. need to be cleaned up.
And it would have been really nice to have an actual ending during Timed Mode, instead of feeling like we were trapped in a boring room with a locked door to nowhere.

Last Will = 7 Useless Lanterns out of 10!

review:
Hello all you Squirrels with sniper rifles! Lord Crocosquirrel here and this is the Last Will review!

Now that the game has been released, I can finally do a Steam review. Let it be known that I not only recieved this game from the devs for free, but over the course of my coverage of the game, several things were fixed or added according to my critique. 

If you want to do a horror game, there are ways to do it, and there are a great many ways to not do it. This one isn't so much a horror game as it is a creepy puzzle game. There have been a couple of others that do this sort of thing, usually done in similar ways. 

So then why pay $13 US for a creepy puzzle game, particularly when there's only an hour or so of gameplay at the moment?

No two playthroughs will ever be the same. The house itself has a number of diffierent configurations, and it's entirely possible to play the first chapter several times without getting the same content. Everything fits more or less seamlessly, and even the puzzles themselves change with each consecutive playthrough-- usually getting harder as you play again and again. I made the mistake of thinking I could just fly right through the first room after a crash the first time I played, and was rather soundly put in my place. 

The last time I played, it still had a couple of bugs in, but most of the truly game-breaking stuff was gone, along with a few bits and bobs that irked me the first time through. 

As for the story, it goes fairly deep-- You are one of the possible heirs to the Gladsbury Estate, and you've been given an hour to get to the core of the house before your Grandfather's attourney arrives. This is stated in the initial letter on the table in the front room, and is one of the few things that never changes. From here, the rest of the tale is told in notes, audio logs, and in the clues to the puzzles themselves. At no point are we given any real information about the Protagonist except presumptive maleness-- the only real characters here are the Professor and the House itself. 

It's well-told for a story that's done in this way. It's an easy thing to muck up, and Lizard Factory manages to deliver on the spooky atmosphere, the threat of death only if you don't make it to the Vault in the time frame adds tension without adding a lot of extra stress, and there are no jumpscares. Not to worry, though. Between the difficulty of the puzzles, the time limit, and the spooky atmosphere, there's more than enough here to get your creepy sensors going full steam ahead. 

As mentioned earlier, the Dev did have a lot of work ahead of him when I first saw it. He was aware of some of it, and not so much some other bits that got much-needed attention. The game comes with one chapter, with the rest due in fairly short order over the next couple of months, free to the purchaser regarless of when they bought the game. So we have a game that's being cared for, has three more chapters worth of content coming sooner rather than later, and is already very replayable. 

The only thing that people might ding this game for is something most reviewers haven't picked up on: The use of purchased assets from the Unity store-- cleaned up, given a fresh paint job, and used in a manner consistent with what the sellers of those assets intended.

Lizard Factory gets a pass on this. More than a few professionals haven't spotted them, and people from my audience that actually hunt for assets in games missed it as well.

I did not have any real contact with the Dev before my initial coverage of the game on SquirrelPlay Live-- just a note to him of the date/time I did the inital coverage, similar to what I would do for any other dev whose games are being played/discussed. He turned up to talk in the chat, and I started talking to him only after that.

Final Verdict: Recommend, 85/100 for originality, responsiveness to criticism, and clever use of assets and story/atmosphere to make spooky without going the direction that most horror devs seem to pride themselves on. Some bugs remain, but nothing gamebreaking anymore. A solid freshman effort. Looking forward to the next three chapters over the next while and a half.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161727032', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 58, 'playtime_forever': 3000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1443, 'last_played': 1581798727}
review:
"Last Will" is a escape-the-room kind of game. You`re exploring the Gladsbury Manor in search of the "heart of the mansion" and you`ll have to solve a lot of puzzles to find it ^^

There will be 4 episodes until October (right now only 1 episode is available). Each episode consists of 5 different rooms where you have to solve puzzles in. They are randomly chosen out of a room pool. Additionally the parameters of the rooms also change if you revisit them again.

That means it`s highly unlikely to get the exact same puzzle again. The developer is even adding rooms and parameters weekly and trying his best to add more stuff to the game. It won`t get boring to even replay episodes, cause it´s possible you`ll get a new set of rooms.

The price of 13$ is definitely justified when enough content is added (middle of October). If you`re a puzzle fan, i`d definitely reccommend this game for you!
